description: Distance of primes to next odd multiple of 5 (where n mod 10 = 5),
example: Take first prime 2, subtract from 5: 5-2=3, distance to 5; take 5-5 = 0; or 4th term, 15-7=8. Sequence may be converted to distance to nearest value of n (absolute value, where n mod 10 = 5) by changing all 8's to 2's and all 6's to 4's.
prog: (PARI) a(n) = {p = prime(n); k = 0; while ((p+k) % 10 != 5, k++); k;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Aug 25 2013
author: _Enoch Haga_
